snippet: The boys’ team at Beacon School in Manhattan won a national high school championship despite enduring long commutes for court space, a problem for many public high school players in New York City.
abstract: Boys' tennis team at Beacon School in Manhattan won 2014 national high school championship despite enduring long commutes for court space, problem for many public high school players in New York City; team caps off its season by taking winning its fourth consecutive Mayor's Cup, city's top event for scholastic players.
lead_paragraph: The boys’ team at Beacon School in Manhattan won a national high school championship despite enduring long commutes for court space, a problem for many public high school players in New York City.

headline.seo: Beacon School Tennis Is Used to Commuting and to Winning
headline.main: A National Title, if Not a Court, of Its Own
headline.print_headline: A National Title, if Not a Court, of Its Own
